intro: Colubrina mocinoana, commonly known as the Mexican beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is a small shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in the spring. These flowers are followed by bright purple to pink berries that ripen in the fall. The leaves are alternate, simple, and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
